What are the roots of the polynomial \( x^2 - mx + n \)?
Confirm the properties of the roots, which are that they are positive prime integers.
Use Vieta's formulas, which relate the sum and product of the roots of a quadratic equation to its coefficients (\( m \) and \( n \)).
Determine the conditions that \( m \) must be less than 20 and analyze how this restricts the possible values of the roots.
List all pairs of positive prime numbers where the sum \( (p + q) \) is less than 20, since \( m = p + q \).
Calculate \( n \) for each of these pairs using \( n = pq \) (the product of the roots).
Ensure each calculation for \( n \) meets the condition of the roots being prime.
Identify unique values of \( n \) from the calculated results. Since \( n \) is the product of two possible prime roots, check which products occur and count distinct values.
